item.title: John Stuart Mill
item.description: Excerpts and notes from Mill’s On Liberty. Some are in the form of a question-and-answer dialogue to address common misconceptions people have about free speech. In particular, I would like to do away with the notion that free speech advocates possess a sort of romantic naivete, foolishly holding on to sentimental notions of man’s natural right to speak, and are blind to the fact that, by indiscriminately providing aggressors with a “platform”, they are merely giving the enemy more ammunition with which to harm him.
